A data transfer object representing a tag filter item with associated device count, used in REST API responses for filtering devices by tags.

## Key Components

- **TagFilterItem class**: Main DTO with Lombok annotations for automatic getter/setter generation
- **value**: The actual tag value used for filtering
- **label**: Human-readable display name for the tag
- **count**: Number of devices associated with this tag
- **Swagger annotations**: OpenAPI documentation for REST API integration

## Usage Example

```java
// Creating a tag filter item
TagFilterItem filterItem = TagFilterItem.builder()
    .value("production")
    .label("Production")
    .count(15)
    .build();

// Using in a REST controller response
@GetMapping("/tags/filters")
public List<TagFilterItem> getTagFilters() {
    return Arrays.asList(
        TagFilterItem.builder()
            .value("production")
            .label("Production Environment")
            .count(25)
            .build(),
        TagFilterItem.builder()
            .value("staging")
            .label("Staging Environment")
            .count(8)
            .build()
    );
}
```

This DTO is typically used in device management APIs to provide filter options with counts, enabling users to see available tags and how many devices match each filter criteria.
